content:
OleDbParameterCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of parameters relevant to an OleDbCommand as well as their respective mappings to columns in a DataSet.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.Editor("Microsoft.VSDesigner.Data.Design.DBParametersEditor, Microsoft.VSDesigner, Version=10.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.ComponentModel.ListBindable(false)]
public sealed class OleDbParameterCollection : System.Data.Common.DbParameterCollection
Inheritance
Object
MarshalByRefObject
System.Data.Common.DbParameterCollection
OleDbParameterCollection

Inherited Members

Remarks

The number of parameters in the collection must equal the number of parameter placeholders within the command text, otherwise the .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB might raise an error.

Properties

Count

Returns an integer that contains the number of elements in the OleDbParameterCollection. Read-only.

public override int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of elements in the OleDbParameterCollection as an integer.

Gets a value that indicates whether the OleDbParameterCollection has a fixed size. Read-only.

public override bool IsFixedSize { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the OleDbParameterCollection has a fixed size; otherwise false.

Gets a value that indicates whether the OleDbParameterCollection is read-only.

public override bool IsReadOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the OleDbParameterCollection is read only; otherwise false.

IsSynchronized

Value

true if the OleDbParameterCollection is synchronized; otherwise false.

The OleDbParameter at the specified index.

Exceptions

The index specified does not exist.

Gets or sets the OleDbParameter with the specified name.

The name specified does not exist.

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the OleDbParameterCollection. Read-only.

public override object SyncRoot { get; }
Value
Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the OleDbParameterCollection.

Methods

Adds the specified OleDbParameter to the OleDbParameterCollection.

public System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter Add (System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter value);

The OleDbParameter to add to the collection.

OleDbParameter

The index of the new OleDbParameter object.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The OleDbParameter specified in the value parameter is already added to this or another OleDbParameterCollection.

ArgumentNullException

The value parameter is null.

Adds the specified OleDbParameter object to the OleDbParameterCollection.

public override int Add (object value);
value
Object

A Object.

Returns
Int32

The index of the new OleDbParameter object in the collection.

Add(String,OleDbType)

Adds an OleDbParameter to the OleDbParameterCollection, given the parameter name and data type.

public System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter Add (string parameterName, System.Data.OleDb.OleDbType oleDbType);
parameterName
String

The name of the parameter.

oleDbType
OleDbType

One of the OleDbType values.

Returns
OleDbParameter

The index of the new OleDbParameter object.

Add(String,Object)

Adds an OleDbParameter to the OleDbParameterCollection given the parameter name and value.

public System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter Add (string parameterName, object value);
parameterName
String

The name of the parameter.

value
Object

The stem.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter.Value* of the OleDbParameter to add to the collection.

Returns
OleDbParameter

The index of the new OleDbParameter object.

Exceptions
InvalidCastException

The value parameter is not an OleDbParameter.

Remarks

Use caution when using this overload of the Add method to specify integer parameter values. Because this overload takes a value of type Object, you must convert the value to an Object type when the value is zero, as the following C# example demonstrates. 

parameters.Add("@pname", Convert.ToInt32(0));

If you do not perform this conversion, the compiler will assume you are attempting to call the Add overload.
